physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Subtle, hypopigmented, 1- to 2-mm, flat-topped papules with prominent eccrine ducts located on the palmar surfaces bilaterally.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Over the course of approximately 1 to 2 years, the patient's problem gradually abated without treatment; in the past 3 years, she has had no recurrence.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Poorly defined white papules and plaques with a slightly firm texture and accentuation of the eccrine ducts on both palms.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: All findings increased in magnitude after running her hands under water.
